question: Will a US debt ceiling raise be enacted by December 15th?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if, by the resolution date, December 15, 2021, 11:59:59 PM ET, federal legislation is enacted which has the result of increasing, suspending, or otherwise adjusting the federal debt limit. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

"Enacted" means the legislation becomes public law.

The resolution source for this market is https://www.congress.gov/. Other credible sources will be chosen if the resolution source is not updated in time.

events.title: Will a US debt ceiling raise be enacted by December 15th?

question: Will Chris Cuomo launch a Substack before January 10, 2022?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes", if before the resolution time - January 10 2022, 12 PM ET - Chris Cuomo, an American television journalist, the former presenter of Cuomo Prime Time launches his own newsletter at Substack.com.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Please note, to resolve "Yes" - it has to be confirmed by Chris Cuomo (either via Twitter or another credible source), or credible news sources that he is the author of the aforementioned newsletter.

question: Will Youtube bring back the dislike count by January 11, 2022?
description:
This is the market on the dislike count under Youtube videos. On November 10, 2021, YouTube officially announced the removal of dislike counts on all videos across their platform. The company stated that the new move was intended to help limit and control targeted harassment towards its creators.

This market will resolve to "Yes", if before the resolution time - January 11 2022, 12 PM ET - the dislike count under at least one video on the Youtube platform will be visible again to the public. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The market will be checked at 12 PM ET daily to see if the dislike count numbers are visible to the public for at least one video. 

Please note that for this market to resolve "Yes", the dislike count for at least one video has to be visible as a number, similar to the one before November 10 2021, and accessible to the public (not to the creator only, and not to Youtube Premium members only), without any additional plugins.

question: Will the USA report a 7-day COVID-19 case average of 200k or more before January 1, 2022?
description:
The market will resolve to “Yes” if the United States reports a 200,000 or more 7-day COVID-19 case average on or after the date of this market’s inception, December 13 2021, and on or before December 31, 2021. 

Otherwise, the market will resolve to “No.” 

This market will resolve on data from the CDC's Data Tracker, specifically, the 7-day moving average of COVID-19 cases for the United States, which is available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailytrendscases (navigate to "Select a state or territory" and select “United States”, and then scroll to "Data Table for Daily Case Trends" and view the data in the "7-Day Moving Avg" column, which is able to be sorted in descending order). 

The resolution source will be reviewed once daily at 8 PM ET, to see if the criteria for “Yes” are met. The final check will be on January 8, 2022, 8 PM ET, checking the 7-day average on all days from the creation of this market to December 31, 2021. 

If the website is down or data is unavailable during the final check, the market will resolve based on the most recent previous check that had data available.

question: NBA: Will the Warriors beat the Pacers by more than 4.5 points in their December 13 matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for December 13:

If the Golden State Warriors win by over 4.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Indiana Pacers lose by less than 4.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by December 20, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.
